mes: Hey, can I talk to you for a second?

res.mes: Yeah, of course. What's up?
Um, yeah. Sure.

mes: I just...don't really know what we're doing. Every time you come over it's like...

res.mes: ...hard to tell what's going on. I know.
It's like what?

mes: I mean...it's just like, how long are we going to keep doing this?

res.mes: I know. It's confusing.
You know we can stop whenever you want, right?

mes: Yeah. I never know what's going to happen, like whether you're going to stay over or what.

res.mes: I'm sorry. I know I need to be clearer about my intentions.
It's just been really hard for me to figure out what I want.

mes: Well, it's just been confusing to me what you want out of this.

res.mes: Yeah, it's just been really hard for me to figure out what I want.
Well, I don't really know what you want either.

mes: I just don't know how sustainable it is. For me, for both of us.

res.mes: You're probably right about that.
Well, do you think we should stop?

mes: If we can stop whenever we want, then why haven't we?

res.mes: Coming over is...easy. Even if we both know it makes things harder.
Why haven't you brought this up before?

mes: Maybe you need to figure out what you want out of this. It feels like it's hurting both of us.

res.mes: Yeah, I can't do this anymore. I should probably go.
I just...really want to stay tonight. If that's ok with you.

mes: I don't know if I can help you if you don't know what you want.

res.mes: I just...really want to stay tonight. Just tonight. If that's ok with you.
Yeah, I can't do this anymore. I should probably go.

mes: Maybe we need to take a break. It feels like it's hurting both of us.

res.mes: I know but...I think I want to stay tonight. Just tonight. If that's ok with you.
Yeah, I mean. That makes sense. I should probably go.

mes: I just...couldn't. Fuck. I'm sorry. I think you need to go. I'm sorry.

res.mes: Yeah. Ok, I should go.
Please just let me stay tonight. Please.

mes: I mean. Probably not a great idea. But I guess we're here already.

res.mes: I'll put my stuff down.
No, you're right. I think I have to go.

mes: I'm gonna take a shower...hey, do you think this will ever be, you know - over?
It's probably for the best. Stay warm out there...oh, and text me when you get home.
I'm sorry. I can't do this. Maybe it's finally over.
// The Part, by Asher Blank. Out 2/11. //
